answers.answer: Dopomoha, as a Commit Global solution, offers support in various areas including Housing, Education, Health, and Transportation. It also provides specific solutions to support refugees such as "Law made simple," which helps citizens understand their rights and obligations, and "PTSD Help," a free assistant for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.
answers.bResponse: Dopomoha, as a Commit Global solution, offers support in various areas including Housing, Education, Health, and Transportation. It also provides specific solutions to support refugees such as "Law made simple," which helps citizens understand their rights and obligations, and "PTSD Help," a free assistant for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer: The available support services cover the following cities: Brașov, Brăila, Constanța, Galați, Iași, Oradea, Suceava, Sibiu, Cluj-Napoca, Timișoara, Bucharest, Maramureș, and Sighetu Marmației.

answers.answer: "Law made simple" is one of two solutions designed to support refugees, specifically helping citizens better understand their rights and obligations.
answers.bResponse: "Law made simple" is one of two solutions designed to support refugees, specifically helping citizens better understand their rights and obligations. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer: "PTSD Help" is a free assistant designed for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).
answers.bResponse: "PTSD Help" is a free assistant designed for managing Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer:
Yes, there are various educational resources available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania. These include information on how to enroll children in educational institutions, such as kindergarten, school, and after-school classes. Specific organizations offering support are JRS Romania, which runs a kindergarten and a school for first graders focusing on adaptation to the Romanian education system and Romanian language study. The Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation also provides a free kindergarten with various activities.

For older students, "Ostrovok" Educational Hub in Bucharest offers free classes for refugee students from Ukraine across different grades (0-11th grade in Sector 2, 0-6th grade in Sector 4). There is also the Taras Shevchenko Ukrainian High School in Maramureș, one of the few secondary schools in Romania with teaching in the Ukrainian language.

Additionally, resources for self-study are available, such as free digital versions of Ukrainian textbooks for grades 1-11, and the Ukrainian Online School, a project by the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine for distance learning for grades 5-11. UNICEF also provides access to online learning platforms to support children's education.

answers.answer: Yes, the non-profit organization JRS Romania offers both a kindergarten for preschool children and a school for first graders. During the school year, first graders are prepared at the school for an easier adaptation to entering the 2nd grade in a Romanian school, with special attention paid to the study of the Romanian language in addition to basic subjects. You can register a child by calling 0744 405 657 or emailing jrsromania@gmail.com.
answers.bResponse: Yes, the non-profit organization JRS Romania offers both a kindergarten for preschool children and a school for first graders. During the school year, first graders are prepared at the school for an easier adaptation to entering the 2nd grade in a Romanian school, with special attention paid to the study of the Romanian language in addition to basic subjects. You can register a child by calling 0744 405 657 or emailing jrsromania@gmail.com. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer: The Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation offers various activities for children and operates a kindergarten where education is free and does not require pre-registration. The kindergarten is open from Monday to Friday, from 10:00 to 17:00.
answers.bResponse: The Angel Appeal Romanian Foundation offers various activities for children and operates a kindergarten where education is free and does not require pre-registration. The kindergarten is open from Monday to Friday, from 10:00 to 17:00. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer: The "Ostrovok" Educational Hubs are located in Bucharest. Specifically, the hub for Sector 2 (grades 0 to 11th) is at Colegiul Național "Mihai Viteazul", and the hub for the 4th sector (grades 0 to 6th) is at Middle School Ienăchiţă Văcărescu.

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education-useful-information

answers.answer: Yes, there is an official online school from the Ministry of Education of Ukraine. The Ukrainian Online School is a project created by the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine to provide distance and mixed learning for students in grades 5-11. It offers free access to education for every student and teacher from Ukraine, including video tutorials, tests, and self-study materials for core subjects.
